channel.title: Errors on Piecewise
channel.description: Recent content in Errors on Piecewise

item.title: D000: Permission denied when querying for a resource (e.g. channel, user, slash commands...).
item.description: This error may occur in a few situations. When accessing a channel you do not have access to When accessing a server you do not have access to (i.e. the bot is not a member of the server) When accessing a message you do not have access to (i.e. it is in a channel or server you do not have access to) When accessing slash commands for a server that has not authorized them.

item.title: D001: Invalid snowflake. Check any provided snowflakes and/or improve input validation.
item.description: This error occurs when a provided Snowflake is invalid. A Snowflake is a 64-bit number, and Discord’s way of creating globally-unique identifiers that point to objects (e.g. messages, channels…). Errors like this can be avoided through increased input validation, and/or ensuring any hard-coded values are correct. Matches exception with text: is not a snowflake Having issues? Join us on Discord or ask for help on the Steam forums.

item.title: D002: You are requesting a privileged intent you have not also requested for in the console. Check that you have requested the intents in the Developer Console.
item.description: This error occurs when you are requesting a privileged intent within Piecewise, but not in the Developer Console. If your bot is in more than 100 servers, you’ll need to contact Discord Support to request access to privileged intents. Otherwise, you can adjust privileged intents within the Discord console. Matches exception with text: Privileged intent provided is not enabled or whitelisted Having issues? Join us on Discord or ask for help on the Steam forums.

item.title: D003: Invalid token. Check that you have entered your bot token correctly.
item.description: This error occurs when you have not entered your bot token correctly. Ensure that you have copied and pasted the token exactly from Discord. Matches exception with text: An invalid token was provided Having issues? Join us on Discord or ask for help on the Steam forums.

item.title: D100: Duplicate interactible ID rejected. Make sure all of your interactibles have unique IDs.
item.description: This error occurs when the specified ID of one or more of your interactibles (e.g. buttons, dropdowns…) has the same custom ID as another interactible. The following is invalid, because two interactibles have the same ID: This can be fixed by changing the ID of the second interactible: Matches exception with text: Component custom id was already specified Having issues? Join us on Discord or ask for help on the Steam forums.

item.title: L000: Required value missing. Check all of your blocks to make sure you have values at all required connections.
item.description: Check your blocks to make sure all required connections have values. You can check which fields are required on any non-extension block by right clicking it and then selecting ‘Help’. Matches exception with text: Unexpected token ',' Having issues? Join us on Discord or ask for help on the Steam forums.

item.title: L001: Tried to query invalid URL. Check to make sure that any URLs queried are valid.
item.description: This error occurs when trying to query an invalid URL. Improve input validation and make sure any hard-coded URLs are correct. If you are using the Mastodon blocks, this error may occur if you use “https://” in your instance location when initializing. Only include the domain name (i.e. mastodon.social) in that box. Matches exception with text: ENOTFOUND Having issues? Join us on Discord or ask for help on the Steam forums.
